intro: Mariscus dissolutus, commonly known as the brittlestem mariscus, is a rare and specialized plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in umbels, and it produces small, dry fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Mariscus dissolutus is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss.
